meanings.definition: A person who sees or looks at something.
meanings.sent1: The beholders in the crowd watched the parade with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The beholders at the art gallery admired the paintings on display.
meanings.sent3: The beholders at the zoo giggled as the monkeys played.
meanings.sent4: The beholders in the courtroom scrutinized every detail of the trial.
meanings.sent5: The beholders on the hill marveled at the sunset's beauty.

meanings.definition: Those who observe or witness an event.
meanings.sent1: The beholders at the stadium cheered for their team.
meanings.sent2: The beholders of the accident rushed to help the injured.
meanings.sent3: The beholders at the magic show gasped in amazement.
meanings.sent4: The beholders of the meteor shower were in awe of the spectacle.
meanings.sent5: The beholders at the party enjoyed the lively atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Individuals who view or perceive something.
meanings.sent1: The beholders of the new technology were impressed by its capabilities.
meanings.sent2: The beholders of the crime scene provided valuable information to the police.
meanings.sent3: The beholders at the concert swayed to the music's rhythm.
meanings.sent4: The beholders of the ancient ruins imagined the lives of the past inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: The beholders of the natural wonder felt a sense of wonder and awe.
